title: Freelancing Skills Coach
shortDescription: Selected as a Freelancing Skills Coach in the prestigious Digital Egypt Pioneers Initiative (DEPI), Round 3, to mentor and guide Egyptian youth as they begin their freelancing journeys. This role combines training, mentorship, and career development, focusing on empowering participants to launch sustainable freelance careers in the digital economy.

longDescription: Selected as a Freelancing Skills Coach in the prestigious Digital Egypt Pioneers Initiative (DEPI), Round 3, to mentor and guide Egyptian youth as they begin their freelancing journeys. This role combines training, mentorship, and career development, focusing on empowering participants to launch sustainable freelance careers in the digital economy.
Through structured weekly coaching sessions, I delivered practical, hands-on guidance covering the entire freelancing lifecycle:
- Profile Setup & Branding: Helping participants build strong profiles and portfolios that highlight their skills and stand out to potential clients.
- Gig Acquisition & Proposal Writing: Teaching effective strategies for finding opportunities, writing winning proposals, and navigating freelance platforms.
- Client & Negotiation: Guiding students on maintaining professionalism, managing client expectations, and negotiating fair terms.
- Financial Management: Introducing essential practices for pricing, invoicing, and handling earnings responsibly.
Key Responsibilities:
- Conducted interactive sessions that combined theory with real-world applications to maximize engagement and learning.
- Guided participants toward achieving program milestones: securing either one freelance gig valued at $300+ or three freelance gigs of any value during the training period.
- Tracked participant progress via official reports, weekly updates, and structured follow-ups to ensure accountability.
- Provided tailored feedback and one-on-one support to students, addressing challenges and celebrating successes.
- Fostered confidence, resilience, and adaptability among participants, equipping them with the skills to succeed in freelancing beyond the program.

This experience not only allowed me to share my own freelancing background, but also deepened my expertise in mentorship, training, and digital skills enablement, while contributing to the national vision of empowering Egyptian youth in the digital economy.

title: Game Asset Designer
shortDescription: As a freelance game asset designer for FiveM, I create and reskin custom clothing assets (including EUP outfits) and integrate them into servers to enhance gameplay experiences. I collaborate closely with clients, manage projects efficiently, and deliver high-quality, tailored designs with ongoing support.

longDescription: As a freelance game asset designer and developer, I specialize in creating custom clothing assets, reskinning (retexturing) outfits, and integrating them into FiveM servers. I collaborate directly with clients to deliver personalized, high-quality designs that enhance their game environments and ensure an immersive player experience.
Key responsibilities and skills:
- Client Collaboration: Partner with server owners to understand their vision and deliver tailor-made assets that align with their specific themes and needs.
- Custom Design and Development: Design and reskin custom outfits, including EUP (Emergency Uniforms Pack) clothes, ensuring high-quality aesthetics and compatibility.
- Project Management: Effectively manage multiple projects, ensuring timely delivery, clear communication, and meeting client expectations.
- Customer Satisfaction: Provide ongoing support and revisions post-delivery, ensuring full satisfaction with the final product.
- Problem-Solving: Troubleshoot and resolve integration and performance issues related to custom assets within FiveM servers.
This role combines my passion for game design with strong freelancing skills, where I focus on delivering professional, creative, and customized solutions to clients in the gaming community.

title: Research Intern - Intelligent Systems & Emergency Evacuation
shortDescription: Selected for a competitive research track on safety-centered intelligent systems, I am working on graph-based routing and lightweight computer vision (YOLO, MobileNet) for emergency evacuation. This internship builds on my graduation project, aiming to produce a publishable paper while applying AI and optimization to real-world safety challenges.

longDescription: Selected from a competitive pool of applicants to join a research track focused on safety-centered intelligent systems.
Topic: Graph-Based Network Generation and Lightweight Computer Vision Techniques for Emergency Evacuation
▫ Collaborating with peers under the supervision of Dr. Noha Gamal (also my graduation project supervisor)
▫ Working with graph algorithms (e.g., Dijkstra, A*) for real-time routing in emergency scenarios
▫ Researching lightweight computer vision models (YOLO, MobileNet) for hazard detection
▫ Producing a publishable research paper by the end of the program
▫ Weekly checkpoints include literature review, methodology design, implementation, and final reporting
This internship supports and extends my graduation project and helps me apply real-world optimization and AI techniques to safety-critical domains.

title: Intern Team Lead – React Frontend Development
shortDescription: As Team Leader in the React Frontend Development track of the Digital Egypt Pioneers Initiative (DEPI), I led a team of six to develop VocaNova, a React-based web app that won 3rd place nationally in the Mega Project category. This role strengthened my technical, leadership, and project management skills while bridging communication between the team, MCIT, and EYouth.

longDescription: As Team Leader in the React Frontend Development track of the Digital Egypt Pioneers Initiative (DEPI), I led a team of 6 to build our capstone project “VocaNova”, which proudly won 3rd place in the Mega Project category at the official DEPI closing ceremony.

My role blended technical development and team leadership, acting as the main point of contact between the team, the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (MCIT), and EYouth Company. I was responsible for aligning our goals, managing team collaboration, and ensuring quality and timely delivery.
Key Highlights:
- Led development of VocaNova, a web app built with React, achieving national recognition and praise for quality and innovation.
- Acted as liaison with MCIT and EYouth, managing communication, deadlines, and documentation throughout the internship.
- Built responsive and accessible frontend components using React.js, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap.
- Explored backend integration using Node.js and Express, gaining introductory experience in full-stack (MERN) development.
- Applied Git version control and followed agile practices for collaboration and sprint planning.
- Supported team members with debugging, code reviews, and task distribution while maintaining a collaborative and positive work environment.
This 8-month internship sharpened my technical, communication, and project management skills, while deepening my understanding of real-world development workflows.

title: CCNA Internship
company: Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (MCIT)
shortDescription: During my internship at the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (MCIT), I gained hands-on experience with CCNA concepts, configuring and troubleshooting network devices, and solving real-world networking challenges. This strengthened my technical foundation and prepared me for advanced roles in IT and network management.

longDescription: During my internship at the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (MCIT), I focused on Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) content, gaining in-depth knowledge of networking concepts and practical skills essential for building and managing computer networks.
Key responsibilities and achievements:
- Participated in hands-on training sessions covering core CCNA topics such as network fundamentals, IP connectivity, and network security.
- Gained practical experience in configuring, troubleshooting, and maintaining network devices like routers and switches.
- Collaborated with a cohort of interns to solve real-world networking scenarios and challenges.
- Enhanced my understanding of modern networking protocols, VLANs, subnetting, and access control.
- Received mentorship from industry professionals, deepening my expertise in networking principles and best practices.
This internship significantly strengthened my technical foundation in networking and prepared me for advanced roles in IT and network management.

title: BSc in Computer Engineering
shortDescription: During my journey at Nile University, I combined academics with leadership and creativity, founding Pixels NU, contributing to IEEE NU, and freelancing as a game asset designer. I also gained technical experience through internships at MCIT and the DEPI React track, where my team’s project earned national recognition, shaping me into a multidisciplinary engineer ready to tackle real-world challenges.

longDescription: I am a senior Computer Engineering student at Nile University with a multidisciplinary background spanning software development, networking, media, and design. My academic journey has been shaped by hands-on projects, national-level internships, and leadership roles, where I’ve consistently bridged theory with real-world applications.
Key highlights:
Proficient in programming, frontend web development (React, MERN basics), networking, and system design.

Gained practical experience through internships at the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (MCIT) and the Digital Egypt Pioneers Initiative (DEPI), where my capstone project VocaNova earned 3rd place nationally.
Founded Pixels NU, Nile University’s first media and design club, and contributed to the IEEE NU Student Branch as a Media Committee Member.
Freelanced as a FiveM game asset designer, delivering custom creative solutions to global clients.

This diverse journey has equipped me with strong problem-solving, leadership, and technical skills, preparing me to adapt to emerging technologies and contribute to impactful projects across multiple fields.

title: Freelancing 101 - ITIDA + GIGs Program
shortDescription: Participated in the ITIDA + GIGs Program, focusing on freelancing skills and digital entrepreneurship. This experience enhanced my understanding of the gig economy and equipped me with valuable tools for successful freelancing.

longDescription: The ITIDA + GIGs Program provided a comprehensive overview of freelancing in the digital age, covering essential topics such as personal branding, client acquisition, and project management.
Key takeaways from the program include:
- Developed a strong personal brand to attract clients and showcase my skills.
- Learned effective strategies for finding and securing freelance opportunities.
- Gained insights into managing projects and delivering high-quality work on time.
- Networked with industry professionals and fellow freelancers to exchange knowledge and experiences.
This program significantly boosted my confidence and prepared me for a successful freelancing career.

title: Artificial Intelligence Fundamentals
shortDescription: Completed the Artificial Intelligence Fundamentals course by IBM, gaining a solid understanding of AI concepts, technologies, and applications. This course equipped me with the foundational knowledge needed to explore advanced AI topics and projects.

longDescription: The Artificial Intelligence Fundamentals course by IBM provided a comprehensive introduction to AI, covering key concepts such as machine learning, natural language processing, and computer vision.
Key takeaways from the course include:
- Gained a solid understanding of AI concepts and terminology.
- Explored various AI technologies and their applications in real-world scenarios.
- Developed hands-on experience with AI tools and frameworks.
- Completed a capstone project demonstrating the practical application of AI techniques.
This course significantly enhanced my knowledge of AI and prepared me for further exploration in this exciting field.

title: Professional Web Development
shortDescription: Completed the Professional Web Development course by Udacity, gaining a solid understanding of web development concepts, technologies, and applications. This course equipped me with the foundational knowledge needed to explore advanced web development topics and projects.

longDescription: The Professional Web Development course by Udacity provided a comprehensive introduction to web development, covering key concepts such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and responsive design.
Key takeaways from the course include:
- Gained a solid understanding of web development concepts and terminology.
- Explored various web development technologies and their applications in real-world scenarios.
- Developed hands-on experience with web development tools and frameworks.
- Completed a capstone project demonstrating the practical application of web development techniques.
This course significantly enhanced my knowledge of web development and prepared me for further exploration in this exciting field.

title: Founder & Leader
shortDescription: As the founder of Pixels NU, Nile University's first media and design club, I built and led a team of 70–100 members across six committees to deliver high-impact creative projects and events. This role strengthened my leadership, project management, and creative strategy skills while fostering a vibrant community for student growth.

longDescription: As the founder of Pixels NU, I established Nile University's first dedicated media and design club, creating a vibrant community of creative minds. Leading a team of 70-100 members across six specialized committees (HR, PR, Graphic Design, Videography, Operations, and Marketing), I oversaw the club’s strategic direction and operational success.
Key responsibilities and achievements:
- Built the club from the ground up, defining its vision, mission, and organizational structure.
- Recruited, trained, and mentored members to foster a collaborative and innovative environment.
- Spearheaded numerous media and design projects, enhancing the university's events and initiatives with professional-grade content.
- Coordinated between committees to ensure seamless collaboration and alignment with the club's objectives.
- Successfully organized workshops, campaigns, and events, contributing to the personal and professional growth of members.
- Championed creative excellence, positioning Pixels NU as a central hub for media and design at Nile University.
This experience honed my leadership, project management, and creative strategy skills, while providing a platform for students to develop their talents and make a meaningful impact.

title: Graphic Designer
shortDescription: As a Media Committee Member at IEEE Nile University Student Branch, I created visuals, managed social media, and covered events to promote initiatives and engage audiences. This role enhanced my skills in media production, teamwork, and strategic communication while supporting IEEE’s mission.

longDescription: As a Media Committee Member in the IEEE Nile University Student Branch, I actively contributed to promoting the branch's events and initiatives through innovative media strategies.
My responsibilities included:
- Designing creative visuals and engaging multimedia content to support event marketing.
- Managing social media platforms to enhance audience reach and engagement.
- Collaborating with cross-functional teams to align media efforts with branch objectives.
- Covering and documenting events through photography, videography, and live updates.
- Applying design and communication skills to effectively convey the branch’s mission and achievements.
This role allowed me to strengthen my skills in media production, teamwork, and strategic communication, while supporting IEEE's mission to advance technology for humanity.

title: Digitopia - 1st Edition
company: Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (MCIT)
shortDescription: Participated in the Idea Submission Phase, showcasing a smart scholar portal project integrating AI and MERN stack technologies.

longDescription: In the Idea Submission Phase of Digitopia - 1st Edition, I presented a project focused on developing a smart scholar portal that leverages AI and MERN stack technologies to enhance the educational experience.
Key aspects of the project:
✅ Integrated AI features to provide personalized learning paths and resources for students.
✅ Utilized the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js) for a robust and scalable web application.
✅ Emphasized user-friendly design and accessibility to ensure a seamless experience for all users.
✅ Collaborated with a team to brainstorm, develop, and refine the project concept.
This experience allowed me to apply my technical skills in a competitive environment while contributing to innovative solutions in education.

title: 20th Undergraduate Research Forum – 1st International Edition
shortDescription: Presented a research project on Network Intrusion Detection using Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Federated Learning, which was accepted for publication in the UGRF Proceedings.

longDescription: At the 20th Undergraduate Research Forum (UGRF) – 1st International Edition, I had the opportunity to present our research project: Network Intrusion Detection System Using Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Federated Learning Techniques.
Key outcomes and contributions:
✅ The project was accepted for publication in the UGRF Proceedings, showcasing its academic value.
✅ Applied AI techniques for enhancing cybersecurity through intrusion detection.
✅ Gained exposure to academic research, competitive presentation, and peer collaboration.
I had the privilege to work alongside my teammates Mohaned Asker, Youssef Mansy, and Mohamed Alaa, under the supervision of Prof. Sahar Selim, whose guidance was invaluable.

title: 19th Undergraduate Research Forum
shortDescription: Participated with two projects: ML-based Network Node Fault Identification and an E-Commerce Database Management System.

longDescription: During the 19th Undergraduate Research Forum (UGRF), I had the opportunity to participate with two research projects that combined innovation, problem-solving, and applied technology:

📌 Network Node Fault Identification using Machine Learning – Leveraged Random Forest algorithms to detect and predict network node failures, aiming to improve resilience and efficiency in computer networks.

📌 E-Commerce Database Management System – Designed and implemented a scalable e-commerce management system using MySQL, Supabase, and Retool to optimize operations like product tracking, customer management, and order processing.

This experience provided invaluable exposure to practical problem-solving, academic research, and teamwork. I am grateful to our mentors Dr. Mohamed Saeed Darweesh, Dr. Abdallah Saad, Eng. Salma Moustafa, and Eng. Shahd Gamal for their guidance.
